DataElement.preferredName: Hematogenous Distant Nodal Metastasis No Finding Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to not finding evidence of cancer that has spread from the organ first appeared to the blood or distant nodes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematogenous Distant Nodal Metastasis No Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to not finding evidence of cancer that has spread from the organ first appeared to the blood or distant nodes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Originating in the blood or spread through the bloodstream.:Far apart in space, time, or relevance from a point of reference.:Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.

Concepts.definition: Originating in the blood, or disseminated by the circulation or through the bloodstream.
Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.
Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: No clinical or radiological e
ReferenceDocuments.description: No clinical or radiological evidence of hematogenous or distant nodal (retroperitoneal, pelvic, mediastinal, peri-portal or peri-aortic) metastasis
